title: index.qmd
text:
1. What do you think being a data scientist is about?
A data scientist is a scientist who makes discoveries in mounds and mounds of data and messy numbers.These discoveries can be forecasts, visualizations or just plain math.
2. What differences/similarities do you see between data scientists and statisticians?
-Data scientists use coding, ML concepts and data wrangling to make sense of the data and the models being used.
-Statisticians essentially do all this without using coding.
-You can be statistician without being a data scientist but it is pretty tough to be a data scientist without being a statistician.
3. How do you view yourself in relation to these two areas?
I see myself more of a data scientist, while I understand the underlying concepts I can only replicate them with the help of the system and handle the models properly only using coding.

title: index.qmd
text:
Second Part


[1] "density"


[1] "list"


List of 8
 $ x         : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y         : num [1:512] 0.00161 0.00178 0.00197 0.00217 0.00239 ...
 $ bw        : num 0.252
 $ n         : int 150
 $ old.coords: logi FALSE
 $ call      : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name : chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na    : logi FALSE
 - attr(*, "class")= chr "density"









```
